snippet: Experts said the world remains far from meeting international goals on climate change.
abstract: Figures issued by the Global Carbon Project show that global emissions of carbon dioxide are slowing somewhat from the rapid pace of the last decade, but growth in coal burning continues to outstrip the growth in other forms of energy; report finds the world remains far from meeting international goals on climate change.

byline.original: By JUSTIN GILLIS and DAVID JOLLY

lead_paragraph: Experts said the world remains far from meeting international goals on climate change.

headline.main: Slowdown in Carbon Emissions Worldwide, but Coal Burning Continues to Grow
headline.print_headline: Slowdown in Carbon Emissions Worldwide, but Coal Burning Continues to Grow

keywords.value: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
keywords.name: subject
